cheatsheet.title: Importing a C/C++ Managed Make Project

intro.description: This guide walks you though the process of importing a Managed Make project into CDT. A managed make project is one where the makefile is managed by the tool, not by manually editing it.

item.title: C/C++ workbench setup
item.description: Start by setting up the CDT development environment.

item.title: Creating a C/C++ Managed Make project
item.description: Choose one type of C/C++ project from the list. Then type a project name, the type of project, and the No Indexer setting.

item.title: Importing files to the project
item.description: For a project to work it needs files. In this step you import your old project files into your new Managed Make project.

subitem.label: Click File > Import and then use one of the following import methods.
To import files from another project, click General > Existing Projects into Workspace.
To import files from the file system, click General > File System.

item.title: Building projects and inspecting files
item.description: In this step you build the program to create a binary and examine it in a couple of C/C++ views.

subitem.label: Click Project > Build All to create a binary of your source file.

item.title: Setup project properties
item.description: With the project imported and able to build, its time now to reset some project properties for easier development.

subitem.label: Right-click the project name in the C/C++ Projects view, then click Properties.
Click C/C++ Indexer, then select Full C/C++ Indexer from the Select Indexer list.

item.title: Running the program
item.description: The final step is to create a run configuration that defines how the program is launched. Note you can define multiple run configurations if desired, each with its own settings.

subitem.label: Click Run > Run.. to run the program.
Create a run configuration by double-clicking the C/C++ Local Application item.
In the Main tab, click Search Program to select the binary to run.
In the Program Selection dialog box, select the binary to run with this run configuration, then click OK.
Click Apply, then click Run to launch the program. The Console view displays the program output.
